title.text: The GW/UMD CLPsych 2016 Shared Task System

introductionContent.text: Suicide is the third leading cause for death for young people, and in an average U.S. high school classroom, 30% have experienced along period of feeling hopeless, 20% have been bullied, 16.7% have seriously considered suicide, and 6.7% of students have actually made a suicide attempt.

The 2016 ACL Workshop on Computational Linguistics and Clinical Psychology (CLPsych) included a shared task focusing on classification of posts to ReachOut, an online information and support service that provides help to teens and young adults (aged 15-24) who are struggling with mental health issues.

entities.text: ACL Workshop on Computational Linguistics and Clinical Psychology (CLPsych)

introductionContent.text: The primary goal of the shared task is to identify posts that require urgent attention and review from the ReachOut team (i.e. moderators).

datasetContent.text: The shared task dataset contains posts annotated with four classes (green, amber, red, and crisis), and the main goal is to correctly classify the posts 167 that belong to the last three classes.
shows the number of posts per class.: Dataset Train-Test Stats

tableCaptions.text: Table 2: Macro F1-Scores on Test Data
